title: Steve Bannon Thinks The Media Should ‘Keep Its Mouth Shut’
text:
“I want you to quote this,” Bannon told the Times. “The media here is the opposition party. They don’t understand this country. They still do not understand why Donald Trump is the president of the United States.” "I want you to quote this," Steve Bannon said. "The media here is the opposition party." https://t.co/CaavOYgmT2 
— The New York Times (@nytimes) January 26, 2017 
Bannon cited obvious bias against Trump during the election season as a clear sign America’s mainstream media was out of touch with the public. Advertisement - story continues below 
“The elite media got it dead wrong, 100 percent dead wrong,” Bannon said. He called it “a humiliating defeat that they will never wash away, that will always be there.” 
That defeat, Bannon said, was the reason they no longer have power. 
Although he doesn’t frequently speak with the press, the former Breitbart executive didn’t shy away from an opportunity criticize the Times. He said the paper “should be absolutely ashamed” in how it conducted itself last year. 
Bannon isn’t alone in this war. Republicans in Congress are beginning to join the ranks and fight for fair treatment. Advertisement - story continues below
